intro: Marsdenia yarlungzangboensis, commonly known as the Yarlungzangbo Marsdenia, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of southern Tibet. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in rocky and mountainous environments, showcasing adaptations to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
